Course Description: PRESENTS UNDERLYING CONCEPTS AND ETHICAL, REGULATORY AND BUSINESS ENVIRONMENT OF FINANCIAL REPORTING.  TOPICS INCLUDE AN EMPHASIS ON MEASUREMENT, VALUATION AND PRESENTATION OF TYPICAL LIABILITY AND EQUITY-RELATED ITEMS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, A STUDENT IS ABLE TO:
1.  UNDERSTAND FINANCIAL ACOCUNTING STANDARDS AS THEY RELATE TO PRESENTATION AND DISCLOSURE OF FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
2.  RECOGNIZE, MEASURE, VALUE AND PRESENT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS IN CONFORMITY WITH GAAP RELATING TO LIABILITIES AND EQUITY TRANSACTIONS
3.  RECOGNIZE SPECIFIC TYPES OF TRANSACTIONS AND EVENTS RELATED TO LIABILITIES AND EQUITY
4.  IMPROVE RESEARCH, ORAL AND WRITTEN COMMUNICATION SKILLS
5.  REINFORCE ETHICAL AND PROFESSIONAL BUSINESS CONDUCT
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
